org.svvrl.goal.core.util

Class TreeNode<D>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.svvrl.goal.core.util.TreeNode<D>
  • Type Parameters:
    D - the type of data contained in this node
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TextNode

    public class TreeNode<D>
extends java.lang.Object
    A tree node can have one parent node and several child nodes. A tree node can also carry some data.
    Author:
    Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeNode()
      Constructs an empty node.
      TreeNode(D d)
      Constructs this node to carry some data.

      Inserts a node as the i-th child of this node.

      Returns the children of this node.
      int getChildrenSize()
      Returns the number of children of this node.

      Returns the data contained in this node.

      • addChild

        public void addChild(TreeNode<D> node)
        Inserts a node as a child of this node. The parent of the child node will become this node.
        Parameters:
        node - a node to be inserted as a child of this node

      • addChild

        public void addChild(TreeNode<D> node,
                     int index)
              throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Inserts a node as the i-th child of this node. The parent of the child node will become this node.
        Parameters:
        node - a node to be inserted as a child of this node
        index - the index of node in the children of this node
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - if index < 0 or index >= #getChildren()

      • removeChild

        public boolean removeChild(TreeNode<D> node)
        Removes a node from the children of this node. The parent of the specified node will become null if it is a child of this node.
        Parameters:
        node - a node to be removed from the children of this node
        Returns:
        true if node is a child of this node
